bibl.note: Greer and Vinsinger Family Collection of American Revolutionary War Documents
In this letter to John Pedrick, Esq., James Buchanan discusses the commission and resignation of his son, John C. Pedrick, Esq., as consul of the United States at the Rio Grande.

div.p: Agreeably to the request, contained in your letter of the 23d inst, I herewith enclose the Commission of your Son, John C. Pedrick Esq. late Consul of the United States at Rio Grande, & which he inadvertently enclosed in the letter tendering his resignation. Of the receipt of his letter, and the acceptance of his resignation, he has been duly notified.

closer.salute:
I am, Sir, respectfully
Your obt. Servant.
